keyMoments.description: Shandia warriors become trapped in Shura's Ordeal of String, prompting Wyper to engage the priest in battle.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the Shandia warriors fighting together in Enel's survival game to reclaim their homeland.

keyMoments.description: Wyper declares the Shandia's ultimate goal to reclaim Upper Yard, their ancestral homeland.
keyMoments.significance: Reinforces the crew's collective mission and 400-year struggle against oppression.

goals.description: The Shandia seek to take back their ancestral homeland of Upper Yard from Enel and restore it to their people.
The Shandia aim to defeat the false god Enel who has oppressed both them and the Skypieans.

keyMoments.description: Enel predicts that his survival game will reduce all 81 participants to just 5 survivors.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Enel's confidence in his army's strength and his own power to control events.

keyMoments.description: Shura, one of Enel's four priests, is defeated by Wyper's Reject Dial.
keyMoments.significance: The second priest eliminated from the survival game, weakening Enel's forces.

goals.description: Enel's forces work to maintain his tyrannical rule over Skypiea and Upper Yard.
Enel's army participates in the survival game to eliminate the Shandians and Straw Hats.

keyMoments.description: Sanji, Nami, and Usopp learn about Impact Dial technology from Gan Fall aboard the Going Merry.
keyMoments.significance: The crew gains crucial knowledge about Sky Island combat mechanics that may help them in future battles.

keyMoments.description: Luffy encounters Wyper, setting up a confrontation between the Straw Hat captain and the Shandia warrior.
keyMoments.significance: The Straw Hats become further entangled in the conflict between the Shandia, Skypieans, and Enel's forces.
